phone_script.p3: I am calling to tell you about a cool new program at our school called the :event_name.
phone_script.p4: In a few days, I will be completing: unit_types at the :event_name. I will be completing between :range_low - :range_high :unit_types … :unit_max is the most I can complete.
phone_script.p5: ___________________, I have a question for you…
phone_script.p6: WILL YOU PLEASE PLEDGE ME A DOLLAR AMOUNT FOR EVERY: unit_type I COMPLETE?
phone_script.p7: You can pledge 1 dollar, 2 dollars, 5 dollars per :unit_type or any other amount.
phone_script.p8: I will call you next week to tell you how many: unit_types I have completed.
phone_script.p9: Thank you for helping me reach my goal!

legal.cookie_policy_banner: We use cookies to help make Boosterthon better. By visiting this site, you agree to our
legal.privacy_policy_intro: We at Booster value the trust our fun run participants place in our company. We take reasonable steps to safeguard that trust by implementing measures aimed at keeping nonpublic personal information about fun run participants in a secure environment, and by using that information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. We gather only the information that we need to administer our business, our security and the security of our fun run participants in order to provide superior products and service. We do not typically share such information with third parties except as necessary to provide services to our visitors and for the other specific purposes described below.
legal.privacy_visiting_our_website_content: You can visit the Booster website (“Website”) without identifying yourself or revealing any personal information. We collect and monitor user traffic patterns throughout the Website according to non-personally identifiable information such as a user’s domain name, IP address, browser type, date and time of access and pages viewed. This non-personally identifiable information is collected in order to measure the number of visitors to our Website and to determine which areas of the Website receive the most traffic.
legal.privacy_children_privacy_protection_cont: Our website is intended to be used by Parents/Guardians of fun run participants and sponsors over the age of 13. By completing the registration process, you are agreeing that you are over the age of 13. We never ask for a child’s contact information. Any personal information of students (name, gender, picture, or personal message) can only be entered by a registered Parent/Guardian.
legal.privacy_information_and_how_header: Information We Collect and How We Use It
legal.privacy_how_we_collect_information_desc: Most information comes directly from the Parents/Guardians of fun run participants when they access and use our Internet services (“Services”). When we use the term “Business Information” in this privacy policy, we mean information that tells us specifically who a visitor is and their contact information, including their name, email address, street address and telephone number. We collect Business Information when a guardian/representative of a fun run participant uses our Services or provides information at our events. Visitors to our Website may also provide Business Information and other data by pledging money towards a fun run participant. A guardian/representative can access their contacts via the Google permissions API if desired. We have taken steps to protect the Business Information of our online users by utilizing 256-bit SSL encryption to help ensure information is secured from unauthorized users, and we protect URI data through encrypted variables so that end users cannot read data in the address bar of their browser.
legal.privacy_how_we_use_information_desc: We do not rent, lease or sell Business Information or Google or Gmail information or contacts to any marketeer. All data and contacts transmitted by the Google API and usage information is never provided to other visitors or third party websites. If you have any questions concerning Google, please visit the link below for further information:
legal.privacy_we_may_share: We may share Business Information or other data collected from visitors with our business associates, including unaffiliated third parties who assist us in administering the Services. We may use, share or transfer Business Information or other data collected from visitors:
legal.privacy_we_may_share_list:
• to provide enhanced services;
  • to resolve disputes;
  • to solicit feedback from fun run participants, including potential participation in focus groups to assist in improving services;
  • to maintain and service our systems;
  • to protect the confidentiality or security of fun run participant’s records;
  • to law enforcement or other government officials to protect Booster or any fun run participants, or in connection with an investigation or prosecution of possible unlawful activity;
  • in connection with a sale or merger of Booster;
  • to recipients of any fund pledges;
  • to our attorneys, accountants and regulators;
  • or for other legally permissible purposes.
legal.privacy_if_participants_choose_we_may: If fun run participants or their parent/legal guardian (if child is less than 13 years old) opt to allow us to use or share Business Information and other data with trusted affiliates, independent contractors and other businesses for marketing and business purposes, we may choose to do so. Fun run participants are provided with an “access code” to input and view personal information. Should a fun run participant choose to give this access code to any third party, for whatever reason, Booster is not responsible for any information obtained by such third party; provided, however, that fun run participant information cannot be viewed or edited by the user once it has been submitted even if an access code is entered by an unauthorized user.
legal.privacy_third_party_websites: This Website may link or refer you to third party websites where our visitors may purchase products and services provided by such third parties. This Privacy Policy only addresses the use and disclosure of information and data collected by us. If a visitor discloses information to other parties, then different rules may apply to those parties‘ use or disclosure of such information regardless of their affiliation or relationship with us. Because we do not control the privacy practices of third parties, visitors are subject to the privacy policies and practices of those third parties. A user of our Website or Services that visits a third party’s website, even by using a link from this Website, will be subject to the privacy policy of that third party’s website. We encourage you to ask questions and review the applicable privacy policy of that website before disclosing information to third parties. We have no responsibility or liability for the independent actions or policies of these independent sites, and are not responsible for the content or privacy practices of such websites.
legal.privacy_cookie_desc: Cookies are small text files that our Website may send to your browser for storage on the hard drive. A type of cookie may be deployed if you use our Services. Cookies can make use of our Website easier by saving your status and preferences upon visits to our site. Most browsers are initially set to accept cookies, but you may be able to change the settings to refuse cookies or to be alerted when cookies are being sent. Although you may have the ability to modify your browser and reject certain cookies, it may affect your use of the Services.
legal.privacy_if_you_have_questions: If you have any questions concerning this Privacy Policy you may contact us at www.funrun.com.
legal.privacy_policy_can_change: We reserve the right to change this Privacy Policy at any time. The examples contained within this Privacy Policy are illustrations and are not intended to be exclusive. If there are material changes to this policy they will be posted on our Website.
legal.participant_agreement_header: PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT, WAIVER, RELEASE AND ACKNOWLEDGMENT FOR EVENTS BY BOOSTER ENTERPRISES, INC.
legal.participant_agreement_intro: Booster Enterprises, Inc. (“Booster”) has been engaged by (“School”) to host and organize a fun run/walk and/or event including the use of inflatables, as well as other learning activities and pep rally type events (collectively, the “Events”) to be held at the School.
legal.participant_agreement_body:
I know that an organized walk/run and/or event including the use of inflatables, regardless of distance or time of participation, can be a potentially hazardous activity regardless of the care taken to avoid injuries and/or illness, and that Participant, which is either myself and/or a child aged eighteen or under for whom I have legal guardianship, should not enter organized physical activities unless medically able and in proper health. I acknowledge that the Events may include other physical activity including walking, running, skipping, dancing, physical exercises, use of inflatables, and jumping that may be potentially hazardous regardless of the care taken to avoid injuries and/or illness. I understand that I am solely responsible for Participant’s health and safety in connection with the Events to be held at the School, and I acknowledge that Participant is physically capable of participating in and completing the Events.

In consideration for Booster’s acceptance of my entry, I assume all risks associated with Participant participating in the Events including, but not limited to, personal injury and fatality, which may be caused by, without limitation, falls, contact with other participants, weather related conditions (including high heat and/or humidity), and other conditions at the site(s) of the Events, all such risks being known and appreciated by me. Having read this waiver and knowing these facts and in consideration of your accepting Participant’s entry, I, for myself, and for Participant, Participant’s heirs, executors, administrators and anyone else entitled to act on Participant’s behalf, to the full extent permitted by law, waive and release the organizers of the Events, Booster and all other sponsors, suppliers, agents and independent contractors of the Events, and each of their employees, officers, agents, volunteers, representatives and successors (collectively, “Booster’s Representatives”) from all claims, demands, actions, causes of action and liabilities of any kind arising out of Participant’s participation in any of the Events. This release includes claims based on the negligence of any type whatsoever of Booster and Booster’s Representatives, but expressly does not include claims based on their intentional misconduct or recklessness. I understand that by agreeing to the release and waiver herein, I am assuming full responsibility for any and all risk of injury, fatality, or property damage suffered by Participant while participating in any of the Events, and I am releasing claims and giving up substantial rights, including any right to sue.

I am eighteen years of age or older, and, if acting on behalf of a minor, have every right to contract for the minor in the above regard.

Should any portion of this Waiver, Release and Acknowledgement be judicially determined to be invalid, voidable or unenforceable, for any reason, such portion of this Waiver, Release and Acknowledgement shall be severable from the remaining portions hereof and the invalidity, voidability or unenforceability thereof shall not affect the validity, effect, enforceability or interpretation of the remaining provisions of this Waiver, Release and Acknowledgement. By clicking “I Agree” below, I acknowledge that I have carefully read this Waiver, Release and Acknowledgement and fully understand its contents, am aware that this is a release of liability and am clicking “I Agree” of my own free will. If you do not agree, please press “I Do Not Agree.” Participant will not be able to participate in any of the Events if you press “I Do Not Agree.”

programs.overview_text_override:
:event_name is hosting a two-week fundraiser powered by the Booster team! Instead of selling items, families will gather pledges to help their school, while students experience a world-class character program and participate in the :event_name. Most students will complete :unit_plural at the big event.

This year, Booster’s character theme is MindSpark Wild West, a Western-S.T.E.A.M. theme all about living with character. In this time-traveling adventure, students must help the MindSpark kids win six “Character Duels” to rescue Dr. Shock from the clutches of Bully Malone and his No-Good Gang.

validation.active_url: The :attribute is not a valid URL.
validation.after: The :attribute must be a date after :date.
validation.after_or_equal: The :attribute must be a date after or equal to :date.
validation.alpha_dash: The :attribute may only contain letters, numbers, and dashes.
validation.alpha_num: The :attribute may only contain letters and numbers.
validation.before: The :attribute must be a date before :date.
validation.before_or_equal: The :attribute must be a date before or equal to :date.

between.numeric: The :attribute must be between: min and: max.
between.file: The :attribute must be between: min and: max kilobytes.
between.string: The :attribute must be between: min and: max characters.
between.array: The :attribute must have between: min and: max items.

validation.boolean: The :attribute field must be true or false.
validation.boosterthon_email: The Email Address appears to be a booster address. This user must be created through salesforce.
validation.confirmed: The password confirmation does not match.
validation.date: The :attribute is not a valid date.
validation.date_format: The :attribute does not match the format :format.
validation.digits_between: The :attribute must be between: min and :max digits.
validation.distinct: The :attribute field has a duplicate value.
validation.email: The :attribute must be a valid email address.
validation.filled: The :attribute field must have a value.
validation.in_array: The :attribute field does not exist in :other.
validation.ip: The :attribute must be a valid IP address.
validation.ipv4: The :attribute must be a valid IPv4 address.
validation.ipv6: The :attribute must be a valid IPv6 address.
validation.json: The :attribute must be a valid JSON string.

max.numeric: The :attribute may not be greater than :max.
max.file: The :attribute may not be greater than :max kilobytes.
max.string: The :attribute may not be greater than :max characters.
max.array: The :attribute may not have more than :max items.

validation.mimes: The :attribute must be a file of type: :values.
validation.mimetypes: The :attribute must be a file of type: :values.

min.file: The :attribute must be at least :min kilobytes.
min.string: The :attribute must be at least :min characters.
min.array: The :attribute must have at least :min items.

validation.required_if: The :attribute field is required when :other is :value.
validation.required_unless: The :attribute field is required unless :other is in :values.
validation.required_with: The :attribute field is required when :values is present.
validation.required_with_all: The :attribute field is required when :values is present.
validation.required_without: The :attribute field is required when :values is not present.
validation.required_without_all: The :attribute field is required when none of :values are present.
